meta.name: Gitsiw (The Admonitions)
meta.description: The third book of the Ethiopic New Testament Church Order, containing warnings and corrections for the faithful.

verses.text: Listen, O Priests, who stand before the altar of the Most High; take heed to your ways, lest you offer the sacrifice with unwashed souls.
If a Priest be found in drunkenness or in the lusts of the world, let him be rebuked; and if he repent not, let him be cast out from the sanctuary.
For the fire of the altar is holy, and it shall consume those who approach it with a profane heart.

chapters.name: Regarding the Purity of the Altar

verses.text: Let no man touch the vessels of the sanctuary who is not clean of body and spirit.
If any man bring an offering to the church, let him do so with a joyful heart; but if he bring it out of pride or for the praise of men, it shall not be accepted before God.
Woe to him who weareth the garment of a monk but hath the heart of a wolf; for he deceiveth men, but he cannot deceive the Almighty.
Let your prayer be in secret, and your fasting be hidden, that your Father who seeth in secret may reward you openly.
If thy brother trespass against thee, admonish him with gentleness; and if he hear thee, thou hast gained a soul.
But if he remaineth in his stubbornness, let the elders judge him, that the root of bitterness may not spread among the flock.
The love of silver is the root of all destruction in the Church; it blindeth the eyes of the wise and perverteth the judgment of the righteous.
Let the clergy be content with what is sufficient for their bread and their raiment, seeking first the treasures of the kingdom.

chapters.name: On the Fear of the Lord

verses.text: The beginning of wisdom is the fear of God. Walk in fear all the days of your life, for you know not the hour when the Bridegroom cometh.
Blessed is that servant whom the Lord, when He cometh, shall find watching.
These are the admonitions delivered unto you, that you may be found faultless in the day of judgment.
He that hath ears to hear, let him hear what the Spirit saith unto the churches. Amen.
